snippet: After years of efforts to halt Iran’s nuclear program, the United States and its allies are imposing sanctions meant to cut the country off from the global oil market.
abstract: News analysis; Obama administration and its allies impose sweeping new sanctions against Iran that are meant to cut the country off from the global oil market; many experts regard it as the best hope for forcing Iran to change its course, but so far the escalating sanctions have failed in their central goal of forcing Iran to stop enriching uranium.

byline.original: By ANNIE LOWREY and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: After years of efforts to halt Iran’s nuclear program, the United States and its allies are imposing sanctions meant to cut the country off from the global oil market.

headline.seo: New Sanctions on Iran Aim at Its Oil Industry
headline.main: U.S. Bets New Oil Sanctions Will Change Iran’s Tune
headline.print_headline: U.S. Bets on Changing Iran’s Tune With New Sanctions Aimed at Lifeblood
